title: Getting Started with CytoProfile
text: goal CytoProfile conduct quality control using biological meaningful cutoff raw measured values cytokines. Specifically, test distributional symmetry suggest adopt transformation. Conduct exploratory analysis including summary statistics, generate enriched barplots, boxplots. , conduct univariate analysis multivariate analysis advance analysis.

title: Getting Started with CytoProfile
text: installation CytoProfile package, make sure install BiocManager mixOmics packages using: can install development version CytoProfile GitHub : Install CytoProfile CRAN :
code: ## install BiocManager if (!requireNamespace("BiocManager", quietly = TRUE)) install.packages("BiocManager")  ## install mixOmics  BiocManager::install('mixOmics') # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("saraswatsh/CytoProfile", ref = "devel") install.packages("CytoProfile")

title: Getting Started with CytoProfile
text: examples using functions provided CytoProfile.

title: Getting Started with CytoProfile
code: # Load in the CytoProfile package library(CytoProfile)  # Loading in data data("ExampleData1") data_df <- ExampleData1

title: Getting Started with CytoProfile
code: # Boxplots without grouping with log2 scaling data_df <- ExampleData1 cyt_bp(data_df[, -c(1:3)], pdf_title = NULL, scale = "log2") # Boxplots grouped by Group with z-score scaling cyt_bp(data_df[, -c(3,5:28)], group_by = "Group", scale = "zscore") data_df <- ExampleData1 # Violin plots without grouping cyt_violin(data_df[, -c(1:3)], pdf_title = NULL, scale = "zscore") # Violin plots grouped by Group with boxplot overlay cyt_violin(data_df[, -c(3,5:28)], group_by = "Group",                          boxplot_overlay = TRUE, scale = "log2")

title: Getting Started with CytoProfile
code: data_df <- ExampleData1 # Histogram of skewness and kurtosis for raw data cyt_skku(data_df[, -c(1:3)], pdf_title = NULL, group_cols = NULL) # Histogram of skewness and kurtosis with grouping (e.g., "Group") cyt_skku(data_df[, -c(2:3)], pdf_title = NULL, group_cols = c("Group"))

title: Getting Started with CytoProfile
code: # Basic usage with default settings data_df <- ExampleData1[, c("Group", "CCL.20.MIP.3A", "IL.10")] cyt_errbp(data_df, group_col = "Group", x_lab = "Cytokines",   y_lab = "Concentrations in log2 scale") # Use mean and SD, log2 transform and show significance with symbols cyt_errbp(data_df, group_col = "Group", stat = "mean", error = "sd",            scale = "log2", class_symbol = TRUE, method = "ttest",              x_lab = "Cytokines", y_lab = "Concentrations in log2 scale")

what: Two Sample T-test and Mann Whitney U Test
title: Getting Started with CytoProfile
code: # Performing Test data <- ExampleData1[, -c(3)] data_df <- dplyr::filter(data, Group != "ND", Treatment != "Unstimulated") cyt_univariate(data_df[, c(1:2, 5:6)], scale = "log2",                 method = "auto", format_output = TRUE) #>   Outcome Categorical      Comparison #> 1   IFN.G       Group   PreT2D vs T2D #> 2   IL.10       Group   PreT2D vs T2D #> 3   IFN.G   Treatment CD3/CD28 vs LPS #> 4   IL.10   Treatment CD3/CD28 vs LPS #>                                                Test Estimate Statistic P_value #> 1 Wilcoxon rank sum test with continuity correction   -2.463    1599.0   0.008 #> 2 Wilcoxon rank sum test with continuity correction   -0.956    1625.0   0.012 #> 3 Wilcoxon rank sum test with continuity correction    9.024    4132.5   0.000 #> 4 Wilcoxon rank sum test with continuity correction    1.690    3091.0   0.000

title: Getting Started with CytoProfile
code: # Perform ANOVA comparisons test (example with 2 cytokines) cyt_univariate_multi(ExampleData1[, c(1:2, 5:6)], method = "kruskal",                      format_output = TRUE) #>    Outcome Categorical            Comparison  P_adj #> 1   GM.CSF       Group             PreT2D-ND 0.8981 #> 2   GM.CSF       Group                T2D-ND 0.8981 #> 3   GM.CSF       Group            T2D-PreT2D 0.8981 #> 4    IFN.G       Group             PreT2D-ND 0.0247 #> 5    IFN.G       Group                T2D-ND 0.5516 #> 6    IFN.G       Group            T2D-PreT2D 0.0247 #> 7   GM.CSF   Treatment          LPS-CD3/CD28 0.0000 #> 8   GM.CSF   Treatment Unstimulated-CD3/CD28 0.0000 #> 9   GM.CSF   Treatment      Unstimulated-LPS 0.0000 #> 10   IFN.G   Treatment          LPS-CD3/CD28 0.0000 #> 11   IFN.G   Treatment Unstimulated-CD3/CD28 0.0000 #> 12   IFN.G   Treatment      Unstimulated-LPS 0.0000

what: Sparse Partial Least Squares Discriminant Analysis (sPLS-DA)
title: Getting Started with CytoProfile
code: # cyt_plsda function. data <- ExampleData1[, -c(3)] data_df <- dplyr::filter(data, Group != "ND" & Treatment == "CD3/CD28") results <- cyt_splsda(   data_df,   pdf_title = NULL,   colors = c("black", "purple"),   bg = FALSE,   scale = "log2",   ellipse = TRUE,   conf_mat = FALSE,   var_num = 25,   cv_opt = "loocv",   comp_num = 2,   pch_values = c(16, 4),   group_col = "Group",   group_col2 = "Treatment",   roc = TRUE )

what: Multivariate INTegration Partial Least Squares Discriminant Analysis (MINT sPLS-DA)
title: Getting Started with CytoProfile
code: # cyt_mint_plsda function. data <- ExampleData5[, -c(2, 4)] data_df <- dplyr::filter(data, Group != "ND")  #data_df <- dplyr::filter(data, Group != "ND" & Batch != 3) # # Change levels to 1,2, and 4 # data_df$Batch <- droplevels(data_df$Batch)  results <- cyt_mint_splsda(   data_df,   group_col = "Group",   batch_col = "Batch",   colors = c("black", "purple"),   ellipse = TRUE,   var_num = 25,   comp_num = 2,   scale = "log2",   verbose = FALSE )

title: Getting Started with CytoProfile
code: data <- ExampleData1[, -c(3, 23)] data_df <- dplyr::filter(data, Group != "ND" & Treatment != "Unstimulated") results <- cyt_pca(   data_df,   pdf_title = NULL,   colors = c("black", "red2"),   scale = "log2",   comp_num = 2,   pch_values = c(16, 4),   group_col = "Group" )

title: Getting Started with CytoProfile
code: # Generating Volcano Plot data_df <- ExampleData1[,-c(2:3)] cyt_volc(data_df, "Group", cond1 = "T2D", cond2 = "ND", fold_change_thresh = 2.0, top_labels= 15) #> $`T2D vs ND`

title: Getting Started with CytoProfile
code: data_df <- ExampleData1 # Generate a heatmap with log2 scaling and annotation based on # the "Group" column cyt_heatmap(   data = data_df[, -c(2:3)],   scale = "log2",  # Optional scaling   annotation_col = "Group",   annotation_side = "auto",   title = NULL )

title: Getting Started with CytoProfile
code: # Using XGBoost for classification data <- data.frame(ExampleData1[, 1:3], log2(ExampleData1[, -c(1:3)])) data <- data[, -c(2:3)] data_df <- dplyr::filter(data, Group != "ND")  cyt_xgb(   data = data_df,   group_col = "Group",   nrounds = 500,   max_depth = 4,   min_split_loss = 0,   learning_rate = 0.05,   nfold = 5,   cv = TRUE,   objective = "multi:softprob",   eval_metric = "auc",   early_stopping_rounds = NULL,   top_n_features = 10,   verbose = 0,   plot_roc = TRUE,   print_results = FALSE )

title: Getting Started with CytoProfile
code: # Using Random Forest for classification cyt_rf(   data = data_df,   group_col = "Group",   k_folds = 5,   ntree = 1000,   mtry = 4,   run_rfcv = TRUE,   plot_roc = TRUE,   verbose = FALSE )

title: Welcome to CytoProfile
text: CytoProfile R package designed advanced cytokine data analysis. provides comprehensive suite functions exploratory, univariate, multivariate analysis well machine learning methods tailored cytokine datasets.

title: Welcome to CytoProfile
text: Exploratory Analysis: Quickly generate enriched bar plots, boxplots, summary statistics assess data. Statistical Testing: Perform t-tests, ANOVA, univariate methods ease. Multivariate Analysis: Utilize PCA, PLS-DA, techniques deeper insights. Machine Learning: Integrate Random Forest XGBoost models predictive analysis. Data Handling: Seamlessly load preprocess cytokine data efficient analysis. can install development version CytoProfile GitHub : Install CytoProfile CRAN :
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("saraswatsh/CytoProfile", ref = "devel") install.packages("CytoProfile")

title: Welcome to CytoProfile
text: Getting Started: detailed tutorial help start using CytoProfile. Function Reference: Complete documentation functions. GitHub Repository: Access source code contribute.

what: CytoProfile: Cytokine Profiling Analysis Tool — CytoProfile-package
title: CytoProfile: Cytokine Profiling Analysis Tool — CytoProfile-package
text: Provides comprehensive cytokine profiling analysis quality control using biologically meaningful cutoffs raw cytokine measurements testing distributional symmetry recommend appropriate transformations. Offers exploratory data analysis summary statistics, enhanced boxplots, barplots, along univariate multivariate analytical capabilities -depth cytokine profiling Principal Component Analysis based Andrzej Maćkiewicz Waldemar Ratajczak (1993) doi:10.1016/0098-3004(93)90090-R , Sparse Partial Least Squares Discriminant Analysis based Lê Cao K-, Boitard S, Besse P (2011) doi:10.1186/1471-2105-12-253 , Random Forest based Breiman, L. (2001) doi:10.1023/:1010933404324 , Extreme Gradient Boosting based Tianqi Chen Carlos Guestrin (2016) doi:10.1145/2939672.2939785 .

title: Dual-flashlight Plot — cyt_dualflashplot
text: function reshapes input data computes summary statistics (mean variance) variable grouped specified factor column. calculates SSMD (Strictly Standardized Mean Difference) log2 fold change two groups (group1 group2) categorizes effect strength "Strong Effect", "Moderate Effect", "Weak Effect". dual flash plot generated using ggplot2 x-axis represents average log2 fold change y-axis represents SSMD. Additionally, function prints computed statistics console. ggplot object returned modification.

title: Dual-flashlight Plot — cyt_dualflashplot
code: cyt_dualflashplot(   data,   group_var,   group1,   group2,   ssmd_thresh = 1,   log2fc_thresh = 1,   top_labels = 15,   category_labels = c(Strong = "Strong Effect", Moderate = "Moderate Effect", Weak =     "Weak Effect"),   colors = c(`Strong Effect` = "red", `Moderate Effect` = "orange", `Weak Effect` =     "blue"),   shapes = c(`FALSE` = 16, `TRUE` = 17),   verbose = FALSE )

title: Dual-flashlight Plot — cyt_dualflashplot
text: data data frame containing least one numeric column grouping column. group_var Character.  Name grouping column. group1 Character strings identifying two levels group_var compare. group2 Character strings identifying two levels group_var compare. ssmd_thresh Numeric.  Absolute SSMD threshold highlighting observations significant.  Default 1. log2fc_thresh Numeric.  Absolute log2 fold change threshold significance.  Default 1. top_labels Integer.  Number variables largest absolute SSMD label plot.  Default 15. category_labels Optional named character vector length three providing alternative labels SSMD effect categories.  Names must include "Strong", "Moderate" "Weak".  Defaults c(Strong = "Strong Effect", Moderate = "Moderate Effect", Weak = "Weak Effect"). colors Optional named character vector mapping effect categories colors.  Names must match category_labels.  Defaults red strong, orange moderate blue weak. shapes Optional named numeric vector length two giving plotting characters non‑significant significant points.  Defaults c(FALSE= 16,TRUE = 17) (solid triangular symbols). verbose Logical.  TRUE, prints computed summary statistics.  Default FALSE.

title: Dual-flashlight Plot — cyt_dualflashplot
text: ggplot object representing dual‑flashlight plot. verbose TRUE, summary statistics data frame printed console.

title: Dual-flashlight Plot — cyt_dualflashplot
text: Xiaohua Douglas Zhang Shubh Saraswat

title: Dual-flashlight Plot — cyt_dualflashplot
code: # Loading data data_df <- ExampleData1[, -c(2:3)] cyt_dualflashplot(data_df, group_var = "Group", group1 = "T2D", group2 = "ND",                        ssmd_thresh = 0.2, log2fc_thresh = 1,                        top_labels = 10)

title: Error-bar Plot — cyt_errbp
text: function generates error-bar plot visually compare different groups designated baseline group. displays central tendency (mean median) bar overlays error bars represent data's spread (e.g., standard deviation, MAD, standard error). plot can also include p-value effect size labels (based SSMD), presented either symbols numeric values, highlight significant differences magnitude effects. output filename provided plot saved disk; otherwise ggplot object returned drawn current graphics device.

title: Error-bar Plot — cyt_errbp
code: cyt_errbp(   data,   group_col = NULL,   p_lab = TRUE,   es_lab = TRUE,   class_symbol = FALSE,   x_lab = "",   y_lab = "",   title = "",   stat = c("mean", "median"),   error = c("se", "sd", "mad", "ci"),   scale = c("none", "log2", "log10", "zscore", "custom"),   custom_fn = NULL,   method = c("auto", "ttest", "wilcox"),   p_adjust_method = NULL,   output_file = NULL,   label_size = 4 )

title: Error-bar Plot — cyt_errbp
text: data data frame containing least one numeric column grouping column. group_col Character string naming column defines groups.  column coerced factor. p_lab Logical.  TRUE (default) p‑value labels displayed group comparisons. es_lab Logical.  TRUE (default) effect‑size labels displayed. class_symbol Logical.  TRUE, p‑value effect‑size labels encoded using symbols (e.g., *, >>>). FALSE(default), numeric values shown instead. x_lab Character string x-axis label.  empty default label generated. y_lab Character string y-axis label.  empty default label generated. title Character string plot title.  empty default title generated. stat Character.  Central tendency statistic use.  Choices "mean" "median"; default "mean".  Added support non‑mean summaries. error Character.  Error measure visualized around statistic.  Options "se" (standard error; default), "sd" (standard deviation), "mad" (median absolute deviation) "ci" (approximate 95 % confidence interval). scale Character controlling data transformation analysis.  Accepts "none" (default), "log2", "log10", "zscore" "custom". custom_fn user‑supplied function applied numeric columns scale = "custom". method Character controlling statistical test used pairwise comparisons.  Options "auto" (default; choose t‑test Wilcoxon based normality test), "ttest" "wilcox". p_adjust_method Character.  non‑NULL, specifies method used p.adjust() correct p‑values across comparisons (e.g., "BH" Benjamini–Hochberg).  NULL (default) adjustment performed. output_file Optional file path.  provided, plot saved using ggsave(); otherwise plot returned automatically printed. label_size Numeric.  Font size p‑value effect‑size labels.  Default 4.

title: Error-bar Plot — cyt_errbp
text: error-bar plot (ggplot object) produced optionally saved PDF. output_file specified, function returns returns ggplot object.

title: Error-bar Plot — cyt_errbp
text: Xiaohua Douglas Zhang Shubh Saraswat

title: Error-bar Plot — cyt_errbp
code: # Basic usage with default settings df <- ExampleData1[, c("Group", "CCL.20.MIP.3A", "IL.10")] cyt_errbp(df, group_col = "Group")  # Use mean and SD, log2 transform and show significance cyt_errbp(df, group_col = "Group", stat = "mean", error = "sd",           scale = "log2", class_symbol = TRUE, method = "ttest")

title: Analyze Data with Principal Component Analysis (PCA) for Cytokines. — cyt_pca
code: cyt_pca(   data,   group_col = NULL,   group_col2 = NULL,   colors = NULL,   pdf_title,   ellipse = FALSE,   comp_num = 2,   scale = c("none", "log2", "log10", "zscore", "custom"),   custom_fn = NULL,   pch_values = NULL,   style = NULL )

title: Analyze Data with Principal Component Analysis (PCA) for Cytokines. — cyt_pca
text: data data frame containing cytokine data. include least one column representing grouping information optionally second column representing treatment stimulation. group_col string specifying column name contains first group information. group_col2 provided, overall analysis performed. group_col2 string specifying second grouping column. Default NULL. colors vector colors corresponding groups. set NULL, palette generated using rainbow() based number unique groups. pdf_title string specifying file name PDF PCA plots saved. NULL, plots generated current graphics device. Default NULL. ellipse Logical. TRUE, 95% confidence ellipse drawn PCA individuals plot. Default FALSE. comp_num Numeric. number principal components compute display. Default 2. scale Character string specifying transformation apply numeric variables PCA.  Options "none" (transformation), "log2", "log10", "zscore", "custom".  "custom" selected, user supplied function must given via custom_fn.  Defaults "none". custom_fn custom function used scale = "custom". take numeric vector return numeric vector.  Ignored otherwise. pch_values vector plotting symbols (pch values) used PCA plots. Default NULL. style Character. set "3d" "3D" comp_num equals 3, 3D scatter plot generated using plot3D package. Default NULL.

title: Analyze Data with Principal Component Analysis (PCA) for Cytokines. — cyt_pca

text: invisible list components: model fitted randomForest model. confusion_matrix Confusion matrix test set. importance_plot ggplot2 object variable importance (mean decrease Gini). importance_data data frame variable importance values. rfcv_result rfcv object returned run_rfcv = TRUE. rfcv_plot ggplot2 object cross-validation error versus number variables, returned run_rfcv = TRUE. rfcv_data data frame summarizing rfcv error curve. roc_plot ggplot2 object ROC curve binary classification plot_roc = TRUE. cv_results caret train object returned cv = TRUE NULL otherwise.

title: Run Random Forest Classification on Cytokine Data, — cyt_rf
text: function first coerces grouping variable factor splits dataset training test subsets according train_fraction.  Random Forest classifier fit training data using specified ntree mtry parameters.  model performance assessed training test sets, results printed verbose = TRUE.  plot_roc = TRUE grouping variable exactly two levels, ROC curve computed test set plot returned.  Variable importance extracted visualized bar plot.  Optionally, cross- validation feature selection (rfcv) performed error curve plotted.  separate k-fold classification cross- validation using caret::train can requested via cv = TRUE.

title: Run Random Forest Classification on Cytokine Data, — cyt_rf
code: data.df0 <- ExampleData1 data.df <- data.frame(data.df0[, 1:3], log2(data.df0[, -c(1:3)])) data.df <- data.df[, -c(2:3)] data.df <- dplyr::filter(data.df, Group != "ND")  cyt_rf(   data = data.df, group_col = "Group", k_folds = 5, ntree = 1000,   mtry = 4, run_rfcv = TRUE, plot_roc = TRUE, verbose = FALSE )

what: Distribution of the Data Set Shown by Skewness and Kurtosis. — cyt_skku
title: Distribution of the Data Set Shown by Skewness and Kurtosis. — cyt_skku
text: function computes summary statistics — including sample size, mean, standard error, skewness, kurtosis — numeric measurement column data set. grouping columns provided via group_cols, function computes metrics separately group defined combination columns (using first element treatment variable second grouping variable, column one given). grouping columns provided, entire data set treated single group ("Overall"). log2 transformation (using cutoff equal one-tenth smallest positive value data) applied generate alternative metrics. Histograms showing distribution skewness kurtosis raw log2-transformed data generated saved PDF file name provided.

title: Distribution of the Data Set Shown by Skewness and Kurtosis. — cyt_skku
code: cyt_skku(   data,   group_cols = NULL,   pdf_title = NULL,   print_res_raw = FALSE,   print_res_log = FALSE )

title: Distribution of the Data Set Shown by Skewness and Kurtosis. — cyt_skku
text: data matrix data frame containing raw data. group_cols specified, columns names group_cols treated grouping variables columns assumed numeric measurement variables. group_cols character vector specifying names grouping columns. provided, first element treated treatment variable second group variable. provided, entire data set treated one group. pdf_title character string specifying file name PDF file histograms saved. NULL, histograms displayed current graphics device. Default NULL. print_res_raw Logical. TRUE, function returns prints computed summary statistics raw data. Default FALSE. print_res_log Logical. TRUE, function returns prints computed summary statistics log2-transformed data. Default FALSE.

title: Distribution of the Data Set Shown by Skewness and Kurtosis. — cyt_skku
text: function generates histograms skewness kurtosis raw log2-transformed data. Additionally, either printResRaw /printResLog TRUE, function returns corresponding summary statistics data frame list data frames.

title: Distribution of the Data Set Shown by Skewness and Kurtosis. — cyt_skku
text: cutoff computed one-tenth minimum positive value among numeric measurement columns avoid taking logarithms zero. grouping columns provided, function loops unique grouping columns computes metrics measurement column within subgroup. Without grouping columns, entire data set analyzed one overall group.

title: Distribution of the Data Set Shown by Skewness and Kurtosis. — cyt_skku
text: Xiaohua Douglas Zhang Shubh Saraswat

title: Distribution of the Data Set Shown by Skewness and Kurtosis. — cyt_skku
code: # Example with grouping columns (e.g., "Group" and "Treatment") data(ExampleData1) cyt_skku(ExampleData1[, -c(2:3)], pdf_title = NULL,   group_cols = c("Group") ) #> Warning: Removed 2 rows containing non-finite outside the scale range (`stat_bin()`). #> Warning: Removed 2 rows containing non-finite outside the scale range (`stat_bin()`).   # Example without grouping columns (analyzes the entire data set) cyt_skku(ExampleData1[, -c(1:3)], pdf_title = NULL)

what: Analyze data with Sparse Partial Least Squares Discriminant Analysis (sPLS-DA). — cyt_splsda
title: Analyze data with Sparse Partial Least Squares Discriminant Analysis (sPLS-DA). — cyt_splsda
text: function conducts Sparse Partial Least Squares Discriminant Analysis (sPLS-DA) provided data. uses specified group_col (optionally group_col2) define class labels assuming remaining columns contain continuous variables. function supports log2 transformation via scale parameter generates series plots, including classification plots, scree plots, loadings plots, VIP score plots. Optionally, ROC curves produced roc TRUE. Additionally, cross-validation supported via LOOCV Mfold methods. group_col group_col2 provided differ, function analyzes treatment level separately.

title: Analyze data with Sparse Partial Least Squares Discriminant Analysis (sPLS-DA). — cyt_splsda
code: cyt_splsda(   data,   group_col = NULL,   group_col2 = NULL,   multilevel_col = NULL,   batch_col = NULL,   ind_names = FALSE,   colors = NULL,   pdf_title = NULL,   ellipse = FALSE,   bg = FALSE,   conf_mat = FALSE,   var_num,   cv_opt = NULL,   fold_num = 5,   scale = c("none", "log2", "log10", "zscore", "custom"),   custom_fn = NULL,   tune = FALSE,   tune_folds = 5,   comp_num = 2,   pch_values,   style = NULL,   roc = FALSE,   verbose = FALSE,   seed = 123 )

title: Analyze data with Sparse Partial Least Squares Discriminant Analysis (sPLS-DA). — cyt_splsda
text: data matrix data frame containing variables. Columns specified group_col group_col2 assumed continuous variables analysis. group_col string specifying column name contains first group information. group_col2 provided, overall analysis performed. group_col2 string specifying second grouping column. Default NULL. multilevel_col string specifying column name identifies repeated measurements (e.g., patient sample IDs). provided, multilevel analysis performed. Default NULL. batch_col string specifying column identifies batch study sample. ind_names TRUE, row names first (second) data matrix used names. Default FALSE. character vector provided, values used names. 'pch' set overwrite names shapes. See ?mixOmics::plotIndiv details. colors vector colors groups treatments. NULL, random palette (using rainbow) generated based number groups. pdf_title string specifying file name saving PDF output. Default NULL generates figures current graphics device. ellipse Logical. Whether draw 95\ figures. Default FALSE. bg Logical. Whether draw prediction background figures. Default FALSE. conf_mat Logical. Whether print confusion matrix classifications. Default FALSE. var_num Numeric. number variables used PLS-DA model. cv_opt Character. Option cross-validation method: either "loocv" "Mfold". Default NULL. fold_num Numeric. number folds use cv_opt "Mfold". Default 5. scale Character string specifying transformation apply numeric predictor columns prior model fitting.  Options "none", "log2", "log10", "zscore", "custom".  "custom" selected user defined function must supplied via custom_fn.  Defaults "none". custom_fn custom transformation function used scale = "custom".  Ignored otherwise.  take numeric vector return numeric vector length. tune Logical.  TRUE, performs tuning ncomp keepX via cross‑validation.  Default FALSE. tune_folds Integer.  Number folds cross‑validation tuning.  Default 5. comp_num Numeric. number components calculate sPLS-DA model. Default 2. pch_values vector integers specifying plotting characters (pch values) used plots. style Character. set "3D" "3d" comp_num equals 3, 3D plot generated using plot3D package. Default NULL. roc Logical. Whether compute plot ROC curve model. Default FALSE. verbose logical value indicating whether print additional informational output console. TRUE, function display progress messages, intermediate results FALSE (default), runs quietly. seed integer specifying seed reproducibility (default 123).

title: Analyze data with Sparse Partial Least Squares Discriminant Analysis (sPLS-DA). — cyt_splsda
text: Plots consisting classification figures, component figures Variable Importance Projection (VIP) scores, classifications based VIP scores greater 1. ROC curves confusion matrices also produced requested.

title: Analyze data with Sparse Partial Least Squares Discriminant Analysis (sPLS-DA). — cyt_splsda
text: verbose set TRUE, additional information analysis confusion matrices printed console. can suppressed keeping verbose = FALSE.

title: Analyze data with Sparse Partial Least Squares Discriminant Analysis (sPLS-DA). — cyt_splsda
text: Lê Cao, K.-., Boitard, S. Besse, P. (2011). Sparse PLS Discriminant Analysis: biologically relevant feature selection graphical displays multiclass problems. BMC Bioinformatics 12:253.

title: Analyze data with Sparse Partial Least Squares Discriminant Analysis (sPLS-DA). — cyt_splsda
text: Xiaohua Douglas Zhang Shubh Saraswat

title: Analyze data with Sparse Partial Least Squares Discriminant Analysis (sPLS-DA). — cyt_splsda

title: Two Sample T-test Comparisons.  — cyt_ttest
text: function performs pairwise comparisons two groups combination categorical predictor (exactly two levels) continuous outcome variable. first converts character variables data factors , specified, applies log2 transformation continuous variables. Depending value scale, function conducts either two-sample t-test (scale = "log2") Mann-Whitney U test (scale NULL). resulting p-values printed returned.

title: Two Sample T-test Comparisons.  — cyt_ttest
code: cyt_ttest(data, scale = NULL, verbose = TRUE, format_output = FALSE)

title: Two Sample T-test Comparisons.  — cyt_ttest
text: data matrix data frame containing continuous categorical variables. scale character specifying transformation continuous variables. Options NULL (default) "log2". scale = "log2", log2 transformation applied two-sample t-test used; scale NULL, Mann-Whitney U test performed. verbose logical indicating whether print p-values statistical tests. Default TRUE. format_output Logical. TRUE, returns results tidy data frame. Default FALSE.

title: Two Sample T-test Comparisons.  — cyt_ttest
text: format_output FALSE, returns list p-values (named Outcome Categorical variable). TRUE, returns data frame tidy format.

title: Two Sample T-test Comparisons.  — cyt_ttest
text: Shubh Saraswat

title: Two Sample T-test Comparisons.  — cyt_ttest
code: data_df <- ExampleData1[, -c(3)] data_df <- dplyr::filter(data_df, Group != "ND", Treatment != "Unstimulated") # Test example cyt_ttest(  data_df[, c(1:2, 5:6)],  scale = "log2",  verbose = TRUE,  format_output = TRUE ) #> Warning: `cyt_ttest()` was deprecated in CytoProfile 0.2.3. #> ℹ Please use `cyt_univariate()` instead. #> $results #>   Outcome Categorical      Comparison #> 1   IFN.G       Group   PreT2D vs T2D #> 2   IL.10       Group   PreT2D vs T2D #> 3   IFN.G   Treatment CD3/CD28 vs LPS #> 4   IL.10   Treatment CD3/CD28 vs LPS #>                                                Test Estimate Statistic P_value #> 1 Wilcoxon rank sum test with continuity correction   -2.463    1599.0   0.008 #> 2 Wilcoxon rank sum test with continuity correction   -0.956    1625.0   0.012 #> 3 Wilcoxon rank sum test with continuity correction    9.024    4132.5   0.000 #> 4 Wilcoxon rank sum test with continuity correction    1.690    3091.0   0.000 #>

what: Pairwise Univariate Tests Between Two Groups — cyt_univariate
title: Pairwise Univariate Tests Between Two Groups — cyt_univariate
text: cyt_univariate supports additional scaling options explicit choice statistical test. categorical predictor exactly two levels numeric outcome, two‑sample t‑test Wilcoxon rank–sum test performed.  Results returned either list test objects , format_output = TRUE, tidy data frame one row per comparison.

title: Pairwise Univariate Tests Between Two Groups — cyt_univariate
code: cyt_univariate(   data,   scale = NULL,   method = c("auto", "ttest", "wilcox"),   verbose = TRUE,   format_output = FALSE,   custom_fn = NULL )

title: Pairwise Univariate Tests Between Two Groups — cyt_univariate
text: data data frame matrix containing categorical numeric variables. scale character specifying transformation apply numeric variables prior testing.  Choices NULL (transformation), "log2", "log10", "zscore", "custom".  set "custom", supply function via custom_fn. method Character specifying test perform.  Use "auto" (default) select t‑test Wilcoxon based Shapiro–Wilk normality tests outcome; "ttest" always use Student’s t‑test; "wilcox" always use Wilcoxon rank–sum test. verbose Logical indicating whether return results. Provided backward compatibility effect printing. format_output Logical.  TRUE, returns results tidy data frame; FALSE (default), returns list test objects similar original function. custom_fn function apply scale = "custom".

title: Pairwise Univariate Tests Between Two Groups — cyt_univariate
text: format_output = FALSE, named list test objects keyed "Outcome_Categorical".  format_output = TRUE, data frame columns Outcome, Categorical, Comparison, Test, Estimate, Statistic, P_value.

title: Pairwise Univariate Tests Between Two Groups — cyt_univariate
text: Shubh Saraswat

title: Pairwise Univariate Tests Between Two Groups — cyt_univariate
code: data_df <- ExampleData1[, -c(3)] data_df <- dplyr::filter(data_df, Group != "ND", Treatment != "Unstimulated") cyt_univariate(data_df[, c(1:2, 5:6)], scale = "log2",                method = "auto", format_output = TRUE) #>   Outcome Categorical      Comparison #> 1   IFN.G       Group   PreT2D vs T2D #> 2   IL.10       Group   PreT2D vs T2D #> 3   IFN.G   Treatment CD3/CD28 vs LPS #> 4   IL.10   Treatment CD3/CD28 vs LPS #>                                                Test Estimate Statistic P_value #> 1 Wilcoxon rank sum test with continuity correction   -2.463    1599.0   0.008 #> 2 Wilcoxon rank sum test with continuity correction   -0.956    1625.0   0.012 #> 3 Wilcoxon rank sum test with continuity correction    9.024    4132.5   0.000 #> 4 Wilcoxon rank sum test with continuity correction    1.690    3091.0   0.000

what: Univariate Tests for Multi‑Level Categorical Predictors — cyt_univariate_multi
title: Univariate Tests for Multi‑Level Categorical Predictors — cyt_univariate_multi
text: cyt_univariate_multiprovides univariate statistical testing categorical predictors two levels.  categorical predictor numeric outcome pair, global test performed, followed pairwise comparisons global test significant.  Users may choose two methods, classical ANOVA Tukey’s Honest Significant Difference (HSD) non‑parametric Kruskal–Wallis test followed pairwise Wilcoxon rank–sum tests.  return format can either list adjusted p‑values outcome–predictor pair , format_output = TRUE, tidy data frame summarizing pairwise comparisons.

title: Univariate Tests for Multi‑Level Categorical Predictors — cyt_univariate_multi
code: cyt_univariate_multi(   data,   method = c("anova", "kruskal"),   cat_vars = NULL,   cont_vars = NULL,   p_adjust_method = "BH",   format_output = FALSE )

title: Univariate Tests for Multi‑Level Categorical Predictors — cyt_univariate_multi
text: data data frame matrix containing categorical continuous variables.  Character columns converted factors. method Character specifying type global test perform.  Use "anova" (default) one‑way ANOVA Tukey HSD "kruskal" Kruskal–Wallis pairwise Wilcoxon tests. cat_vars Optional character vector predictor column names.  NULL, factor character columns data used. cont_vars Optional character vector numeric outcome variable names.  NULL, numeric columns data used. p_adjust_method Character string specifying method p‑value adjustment across pairwise comparisons.  Passed p.adjust.  Default "BH". format_output Logical.  TRUE, returns tidy data frame; otherwise (default) returns list numeric vectors keyed "Outcome_Categorical".  numeric vector contains adjusted p‑values pairwise comparisons.

title: Univariate Tests for Multi‑Level Categorical Predictors — cyt_univariate_multi
text: Either list (format_output = FALSE) data frame (format_output = TRUE).

text: Shubh Saraswat

what: Violin Plots for Continuous Variables with Optional Grouping — cyt_violin
title: Violin Plots for Continuous Variables with Optional Grouping — cyt_violin
text: cyt_violin produces violin plots numeric variable data, optionally grouped one categorical variables. grouping specified, function behaves similarly cyt_bp uses violins instead boxplots supports pagination via bin_size argument.  grouping provided, separate violin drawn level (interaction levels) grouping variables.  Users may optionally overlay boxplots within violin visualize median interquartile range.

title: Violin Plots for Continuous Variables with Optional Grouping — cyt_violin
code: cyt_violin(   data,   pdf_title = NULL,   group_by = NULL,   bin_size = 25,   y_lim = NULL,   scale = c("none", "log2", "log10", "zscore", "custom"),   custom_fn = NULL,   boxplot_overlay = FALSE )

title: Violin Plots for Continuous Variables with Optional Grouping — cyt_violin
text: data matrix data frame containing numeric categorical variables. pdf_title Optional string specifying name PDF file created.  NULL (default), plots drawn current graphics device. group_by Optional character vector specifying one columns use grouping.  NULL (default) grouping applied. bin_size Integer.  Maximum number violins per page grouping used.  Default 25, mirroring cyt_bp. y_lim Optional numeric vector giving y‑axis limits plots.  Applies plots. scale Character specifying transformation numeric variables.  Accepts "none", "log2", "log10", "zscore", "custom".  "custom", supply function via custom_fn. custom_fn user supplied function transform numeric columns scale = "custom". boxplot_overlay Logical.  TRUE, narrow boxplot drawn inside violin summarize median quartiles. Default FALSE.

title: Volcano plot — cyt_volc
text: function subsets numeric columns input data compares based selected grouping column. computes fold changes (ratio means) associated p-values numeric variable two groups. results log2-transformed (fold change) -log10-transformed (p-values) generate volcano plot. Additionally, choice t‑tests Wilcoxon rank‑sum tests adjusting p‑values multiple comparisons

title: Volcano plot — cyt_volc
code: cyt_volc(   data,   group_col,   cond1 = NULL,   cond2 = NULL,   fold_change_thresh = 2,   p_value_thresh = 0.05,   top_labels = 10,   method = c("ttest", "wilcox"),   p_adjust_method = NULL,   add_effect = FALSE,   verbose = FALSE )

title: Volcano plot — cyt_volc
text: data data frame containing numeric variables grouping column. group_col Character.  Name grouping column. cond1 Character strings specifying levels group_col compare.  either NULL, pairwise combinations conditions used. cond2 Character strings specifying levels group_col compare.  either NULL, pairwise combinations conditions used. fold_change_thresh Numeric.  Threshold absolute fold change (original scale).  Default 2. p_value_thresh Numeric.  Threshold p‑value (raw adjusted).  Default 0.05. top_labels Integer.  Number top points label plot.  Default 10. method Character.  Statistical test use.  "ttest" (default) uses two‑sample t‑tests; "wilcox" uses Wilcoxon rank‑sum tests. p_adjust_method Character NULL.  Method adjust p‑values across variables within comparison (e.g., "BH"). NULL (default) adjustment performed. See p.adjust details. add_effect Logical.  TRUE, effect sizes computed returned results (Cohen's d t‑tests; rank‑biserial Wilcoxon).  Default FALSE. verbose Logical.  TRUE, prints data frame used final comparison without label column.  Default FALSE.

title: Volcano plot — cyt_volc
text: list ggplot objects (one per comparison).  plot visualizes log2 fold change x‑axis –log10 (adjusted) p‑value y‑axis.  underlying data used construct final plot printed verbose = TRUE.

what: Run XGBoost Classification on Cytokine Data. — cyt_xgb
title: Run XGBoost Classification on Cytokine Data. — cyt_xgb
text: function trains evaluates XGBoost classification model cytokine data. allows hyperparameter tuning, cross-validation, visualizes feature importance.

title: Run XGBoost Classification on Cytokine Data. — cyt_xgb
code: cyt_xgb(   data,   group_col,   train_fraction = 0.7,   nrounds = 500,   max_depth = 6,   learning_rate = 0.1,   nfold = 5,   cv = FALSE,   objective = "multi:softprob",   early_stopping_rounds = NULL,   eval_metric = "mlogloss",   min_split_loss = 0,   colsample_bytree = 1,   subsample = 1,   min_child_weight = 1,   top_n_features = 10,   verbose = 0,   plot_roc = FALSE,   print_results = FALSE,   seed = 123,   scale = c("none", "log2", "log10", "zscore", "custom"),   custom_fn = NULL )

title: Run XGBoost Classification on Cytokine Data. — cyt_xgb
text: data data frame containing numeric predictor variables one grouping column.  Non-numeric predictor columns coerced numeric possible. group_col Character string naming column contains class labels (target variable).  Required. train_fraction Numeric 0 1 specifying proportion samples used model training.  remainder reserved testing.  Default 0.7. nrounds Integer specifying number boosting rounds. Default 500. max_depth Integer specifying maximum depth tree. Default 6. learning_rate Numeric specifying learning rate.  Default 0.1. nfold Integer specifying number folds cross-validation cv = TRUE.  Default 5. cv Logical indicating whether perform cross-validation using xgb.cv.  Default FALSE. objective Character string specifying objective function.  multi-class classification use "multi:softprob"; binary classification use "binary:logistic".  Default "multi:softprob". early_stopping_rounds Integer specifying number rounds without improvement trigger early stopping.  Default NULL (early stopping). eval_metric Character specifying evaluation metric used training.  Default "mlogloss". min_split_loss Numeric specifying minimum loss reduction required make partition.  Default 0. colsample_bytree Numeric specifying subsample ratio columns constructing tree.  Default 1. subsample Numeric specifying subsample ratio training instances.  Default 1. min_child_weight Numeric specifying minimum sum instance weight needed child.  Default 1. top_n_features Integer specifying number top features display importance plot.  Default 10. verbose Integer (0, 1 2) controlling verbosity xgb.train.  Default 1.  Larger values print information. plot_roc Logical indicating whether plot ROC curve compute AUC binary classification.  Default FALSE. print_results Logical.  TRUE, prints confusion matrix, top features cross-validation metrics console.  Default FALSE. seed Optional integer seed reproducibility.  Default 123. scale Character string specifying transformation apply numeric predictors prior model fitting.  Possible values "none", "log2", "log10", "zscore" "custom".  set "custom" user defined function must supplied via custom_fn.  Defaults "none". custom_fn custom transformation function used scale = "custom".  Ignored otherwise.  take numeric vector return numeric vector length.

title: Run XGBoost Classification on Cytokine Data. — cyt_xgb
text: invisible list elements: model (trained xgboost object), confusion_matrix (test set confusion matrix), importance (variable importance matrix), class_mapping (mapping class names numeric labels), cv_results (cross-validation results cv=TRUE), importance_plot (ggplot2 object top feature importance), roc_plot (ROC curve binary classification plot_roc=TRUE).  plots printed automatically.

title: Run XGBoost Classification on Cytokine Data. — cyt_xgb
code: data_df0 <- ExampleData1 data_df <- data.frame(data_df0[, 1:3], log2(data_df0[, -c(1:3)])) data_df <- data_df[, -c(2:3)] data_df <- dplyr::filter(data_df, Group != "ND") cyt_xgb(  data = data_df,  group_col = "Group",  nrounds = 250,  max_depth = 4,  min_split_loss = 0,  learning_rate = 0.05,  nfold = 5,  cv = FALSE,  objective = "multi:softprob",  eval_metric = "auc",  plot_roc = TRUE,  print_results = FALSE)

title: CytoProfile (development version)
text: New functions ‘cyt_univariate’ t-test wilcoxon rank sum test ‘cyt_univariate_multi’ ANOVA Kruskal-Wallis test added conduct univariate statistical analysis multiple groups. Changed ‘cyt_bp’ adapt grouping similar ‘cyt_bp2’ longer need separate functions New function ‘cyt_violin’ creating violin plots statistical comparisons groups. Two new helper functions apply different types transformations adjust p-values. Added options scale/transformations functions require added p-value adjustment options needed.

title: CytoProfile 0.2.3
text: CRAN release: 2025-12-06

title: CytoProfile 0.2.3
text: Make ‘cyt_xgb’ compatible upcoming XGBoost R package changes (parameter renames, changes predict() output). Fix ROC/AUC computation confusion matrix computation XGBoost models. Deprecate arguments ‘eta’ ‘gamma’ cyt_xgb() favor ‘learning_rate’ ‘min_split_loss’ using lifecycle package.

title: CytoProfile 0.2.2
text: CRAN release: 2025-09-04

title: CytoProfile 0.2.2
text: ‘cyt_mint_splsda’, new function conducting multivariate integrative analysis using sparse partial least squares discriminant analysis (sPLS-DA) multiple datasets, added. ‘cyt_splsda’ now new arguments: ‘batch_col’ specify batch column batch correction sPLS-DA analysis using Z-score method. ‘multilevel_col’ specify multilevel column multilevel analysis sPLS-DA. ‘ind_names’ specify custom individual names samples plots. Added new “ExampleData5” dataset “ExampleData1” batch column demonstration ‘batch_col’ argument ‘cyt_mint_splsda’. ‘cyt_heatmap’ now uses pheatmap plotting, provides proper legend along additional scaling options.

title: CytoProfile 0.2.2
text: Updated vignette README files include examples new ‘cyt_mint_splsda’ function. Updated ‘cyt_splsda’ ‘cyt_pca’ logic.

text: CRAN release: 2025-05-19

title: CytoProfile 0.2.1

Fixed grammatical spelling issues README file. Vignette package now show plots generated aren’t saved PDF files. temporary directory created anymore.

title: CytoProfile 0.0.0.9000 (Development Version)
text: Added functions ANOVA, Boxplots, Dual-Flashlight Plot, Error-Bar Plot, Heatmap, Principal Component Analysis (PCA), Random Forest, Skewness Kurtosis, Sparse Partial Least Squares - Discriminant Analysis (sPLS-DA), T-Test, Volcano Plot, Extreme Gradient Boosting (XGBoost).

title: CytoProfile 0.0.0.9000 (Development Version)
text: Added vignette demonstrate usage package. Added built-data sets demonstration purposes. Examples documentation now working expected. ‘cyt_splsda’ now able use one grouping column run analysis. ‘cyt_skku’ now prints output readable format.
